snippet: Growing up amid the fight against terrorism, a generation is buffeted by prejudice and politics, and parents and counselors are growing concerned about the toll it is taking.
abstract: Young generation of Muslim Americans who have grown up amid fight against terrorism are coping with strain of suspicion and struggling with questions of identity, politics and faith; many of them feel isolated and alienated, unsure if they are really accepted as Americans.
lead_paragraph: Growing up amid the fight against terrorism, a generation is buffeted by prejudice and politics, and parents and counselors are growing concerned about the toll it is taking.

headline.main: Young Muslim Americans Are Feeling the Strain of Suspicion
headline.print_headline: Muslim Youths in U.S. Feel Strain of Suspicion
